DOC.brief_summary: Background : Common mental illness , anxiety disorder depression , main cause sick leave Sweden . Cognitive behavior therapy ( CBT ) show effective alleviate target symptom disorder , effect sick leave rate sufficiently address . The investigator develop intervention call return work ( RTW ) , base cognitive behavioral theory , primary aim help sick-listed patient common mental illness return work . This new treatment evaluate randomize controlled trial . Aims : The aim study investigate effect CBT RTW subclinical common mental illness randomize control trial conduct primary care . Participants randomize diagnosis specific CBT ( n=50 ) , RTW ( n=50 . Main outcomes day sick leave clinician severity rating psychiatric symptom . This study could contribute new knowledge regard best treat patient sick leave mild common mental illness .
DOC.brief_title: CBT v RTW Intervention Patients With Common Subclinical Mental Illness Primary Care
DOC.criteria: Have sick leave ( least 50 % ) least 1 month 6 month Have subclinical level anxiety disorder diagnosis ( obsessive compulsive disorder , social phobia , panic disorder , generalize anxiety disorder , posttraumatic stress disorder , specific phobia ) , or/and major depression , or/and maladaptive stress reaction , or/and primary insomnia . Severity measure clinical severity rating ( CSR ) 23 mild subclinical level A higer score 3 Clinician severity rating scale A low score 2 Clinician severity rating scale
